appPermission.message: The application permissions are not properly set. Please add additional permissions and try again

v1.instance: The instance id for empathy search API
v1.sink: Represents the type of event it can be a query or a click
v1.ip: Represents the ip address from the query
v1.endpoint: Represents the endpoint used in the search
v1.service: Represents the service used in the search
v1.timestamp: The time the query was performed
v1.totalhits: Number of total results for these search terms.
v1.page: Page number the user has requested.
v1.user: The user used on this request.
v1.filters: Represents the filters used in the query.
v1.usert: Specifies is the user who made the request is either new, recurrent, or ignored.

origin.title: Type of search performed, these are the possible values:
origin.default: default : common search without help of any feature.
origin.variables: empathize_category, empathize_term, empathize_reference, empathize_recommendations, empathize_next_queries, empathize_trending: search using empathize
origin.partial: partial : new search with origin in a suggestion in a non results query
origin.next: next_query, next_query_grid : search by selecting a next_query
origin.related: related_tag : search by selecting a related tag
origin.history: history: search by selecting a term in the history

v1.spellcheck: Represents whether the query has come via spellcheck or not.
v1.filtered: Represents whether the query has been filtered or not.
v1.con: Represents whether the query has been through the contextualize method.
v1.cone: Represents whether the user has contextualized enabled.
v1.cona: Represents whether the query has applied the contextualize method.
v1.revenue: Numeric value of the product revenue/price
v1.currency: Currency code for the revenue amount. Must be a valid ISO 4217 currency code.
v1.trans: Arbitrary identifier to link all checkout events that correspond to a unique transaction - typically a UUID, the important thing is for it to be unique and consistent for transactions.
v1.catid: The category that has been clicked to filter by.
v1.title: Link title of the query.
v1.topclicked: The top clicked values of the query
v1.boostedid: Manual boost Id, required for default boosts.

welcome.title: <0>This application is being developed to improve the user experience so it is easier and clearer for each user to interact with its POD.</1></0>
welcome.description: <0>The application is being developed by Astrid Gamoneda Arruñada, from the WESO research group, in collaboration with  <1> empathy.co </1>, the eCommerce Search behind top world brands as Kroger, Carrefour or the Inditex Group. The main objectives of this application are the following:</0>
welcome.libraryList: <0><0><0> Improve user experience </0> for the moment, interacting with a POD is complex and difficult if you're not used to the computer science world. We're trying to make it easier for the users to manage the data they want to store in their POD, because the first step to gain users, is to make their life easier.</0><1><0>Improve security and privacy:</0> With the actual way to manage the POD, there are some critical security flaws, for example, granting access to a user so he can deny you access to your own POD, this should not be allowed.</1><1>Build the starting point: a prototype of a search engine based on the SOLID platfrom/principles.</1></0>
welcome.fairUsageText: The Solid and inrupt logos included in the Generator are for the purposes of example and attribution. We expect application developers will fork the design system and customize to include your own brand in your Solid application projects, or override the example theme in your application code.
welcome.fairUsageExamples: <0><0> If your application is Solid compatible, you can use the Solid logo to indicate that. If not, please don’t misrepresent yourself by using the Solid logo.</0><1>Please don't use the inrupt name as a part of your company name, website name, domain name, service name, or app name. Don't use our logo as your own or modify it to fit into your own logo.</1><2>If you’d like, you may use the inrupt logo to indicate that your application is powered by inrupt’s SDK, but please make sure the context is clear to the user. Your own logo should always be larger than inrupt’s logo, for example.</2></0>
welcome.fairUsageSummary: In general, please apply common sense and honesty to your use of Solid or inrupt logos. Don’t use either to imply a partnership or official endorsement where none exists.
welcome.contactUsText: <0>If you have additional questions about the use of the Solid React SDK by inrupt, the Application Generator, or inrupt’s brand, please contact <1>support@inrupt.com<1>.</0>
welcome.evolvingMessage: <0> The application is continuously evolving: Different aspects are changing, such as the user interface, and application functionalities are being added and edited.</0>
welcome.implementing: This application is being built with the ReactJs framework, using different libraries to communicate with the PODs. All the relevant technical information will be shared in the future in the documentation of the application.
welcome.version010: <0><0><0>Internationalization</0> best practices, with application session language selection.</0><0>Ability to update your profile image on the Welcome page.</0> </0>
welcome.version030: <0><0>Implementing the ability to view and edit your <1>User Profile</1></0><1>Including an Application Footer that displays the build number and links to resources.</1><2>Addressing several minor issues based on user feedback.</2></0>
welcome.version050: This latest release builds on the prior versions and includes a major reworking of the Profile page. The Profile form is now dynamically generated based on a shape and provides compatibility with the Solid Data Browser by allowing multiple addresses, emails, and phone numbers.
